definition: abbr. for Yupian 玉篇[Yu4 pian1] and Guangyun 廣韻|广韵[Guang3 yun4]
sheet/piece of writing/bound set of bamboo slips used for record keeping (old)/classifier for written items: chapter, article
the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
to have no basis in fact (idiom)
sage Emperors Shun and Yao rule every day (idiom); all for the best in the best of all possible worlds
variant of 冗詞|冗词[rong3 ci2]
lit. piles of work and papers (idiom); fig. accumulated backlog of work
lit. to burn both fragrant orchids and stinking weeds (idiom); fig. to destroy indiscriminately the noble and common/the rain falls on the just and unjust alike
lit. to tune one's zither then play it; fig. to live by the consequences of one's actions/to make one's bed then lie on it
lit. the eye cannot bear to see it (idiom); a scene too pitiful to behold
one is judged by the company one keeps (idiom)
